p: Furthermore, use of Pinus sylvestris L. ( Pinaceae), Origanum vulgare L. ( Lamiaceae), and Thymus vulgaris L. ( Lamiaceae) EO and their main components to enhance itraconazole activity against azole susceptible/not-susceptible Cryptococcus neoformans strains has recently been reported, and the results have shown positive outcomes [ 92].
